title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 10, ch. I, pt. 16 - Ionizing Radiation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 10, ch. I, pt. 16 - Ionizing Radiation

State Regulations
§ 16.0 - Introductory note

General Provisions (§ 16.1 to 16.27)

Radiation Equipment (§ 16.40 to 16.70)

Licensing of Radioactive Materials (§ 16.100 to 16.112)

Human Uses of Radioactive Materials (§ 16.120 to 16.200)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. tit. 10, ch. I, pt. 16

Statutory authority: Public Health Law, §§ 201[1][r], 225

Introductory note: Introductory note:Sections under this heading contain the
registration and transfer notification provisions for radiation equipment and
general and additional radiation protection requirements applicable only to
specific radiation equipment

Introductory note: Introductory note:The sections under this heading contain the
licensing provisions for radioactive material, i.e., by-product material, source material, special nuclear material in quantities not sufficient to form
a critical mass naturally occurring radioactive material, and accelerator
produced radioactive material

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
